column3:
<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The unnerved hunter appears too frightened to move.
Keep lookout at the designated locations and slay any beasts that appear.
Y-You travel with Wuk Lamat, don't you? That means you must be strong, and strong's what I need right about now!
These ruins tend to attract wild beasts, so we send out regular patrols to check them from time to time. But as soon as I got here, I was overwhelmed!
I managed to fight them off and escape, but my weapons broke in the struggle. I can't hope to finish my patrol now, unless I want to end up as some fiend's lunch...
I hate to shirk my duty like this, but I have no choice but to ask you to patrol the area in my stead. Those things might still be lurking about─if you find them, I reckon you know what to do.
I'm helpless without my weapons. Please, patrol the area in my stead─and be vigilant for any remaining fiends.
You sense no hostile presences nearby.
You're back. I heard the sounds of battle, but all seems quiet now... Thank you.
You wouldn't think it to see the ruins now, but this place used to be a vibrant village of gatherers. They took their bounty from the verdant nature around them.
But they weren't a fighting people, and as our conflict with the Mamool Ja escalated, one by one they chose to find safety elsewhere...until their home was abandoned completely.

Ilyon Asoh means “scars that remain.” And this place is a scar we all bear. We keep the old buildings here as a reminder of the toll war exacts on us all, so that we don't repeat the mistakes of the past.
Well, I'd better report to the hunters that all is well. Here, please accept this token of my gratitude!
